subject: Sales
title: Loss Aversion in Sales
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Loss Aversion in Sales.

hook.text: People fight harder to keep $100 than to earn $100. Losing stings more than winning thrills.

buildup.text: Kahneman and Tversky called it loss aversion. Losses loom about twice as large as equal gains.

discovery.text: Free trials convert well because of this. Once you have something, giving it up feels like a loss.

twist.text: Insurance exploits loss aversion daily. They don't sell coverage. They sell fear of losing everything.

climax.text: Frame your offer around what the buyer keeps, not what they gain. Protection outsells opportunity.

punchline.text: Protecting what we have beats chasing what we don't.

quiz.question: Why do free trials convert so well?
options: Giving up something feels like a loss
